title: How Many Calories in a Spoonful of Peanut Butter?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a spoonful of peanut butter, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, fats, and simple tweaks for your diet.
h1: How Many Calories in a Spoonful of Peanut Butter?
assumptions: Standard tablespoon spoonful (~16 g), smooth natural peanut butter, no added sugars or oils.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, type (natural vs. processed), consistency, and portion size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One spoonful (1 tbsp) of peanut butter provides ~94 kcal and ~4 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories are in a spoonful of peanut butter?
faqs.a: About 94 kcal for one tablespoon (16 g) of natural peanut butter.

faqs.q: Is peanut butter high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, one spoonful has ~4 g protein, making it a good snack option.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a spoonful of peanut butter?
faqs.a: Around 8 g total fat, including 1.6 g saturated fat, mostly healthy unsaturated fats.

faqs.q: Does spoonful size affect calories in peanut butter?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”a teaspoon is ~32 kcal, while a heaping tablespoon can exceed 100 kcal.

faqs.q: What's the difference between natural and regular peanut butter calories?
faqs.a: Natural has fewer additives and sugars; regular may add ~10-20 kcal per spoonful from oils and sugar.
